metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3566 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The SSL protocol 3.0, as used in OpenSSL through 1.0.1i and other products,uses nondeterministic CBC padding, which makes it easier forman-in-the-middle attackers to obtain cleartext data via a padding-oracleattack, aka the "POODLE" issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu9
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu9
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.17.1-0ubuntu1
libnss3-1d - 2:3.17.1-0ubuntu1
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.17.1-0ubuntu1
libnss3-tools - 2:3.17.1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

pound - 2.6-6.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu9').
nss package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:3.17.1-0ubuntu1').
pound package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6-6.1').
